title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The current code in BidiUtil in win32 uses Class.forName() to load the BidiUtil class as a callback. However, this approach may cause performance issues and unnecessary overhead.
EB: The BidiUtil class in win32 should be loaded directly as a callback, without using Class.forName().
SR:
Change the line above to: static Callback callback = new Callback(new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4);

I haven't tested it, but it should function the same way as the existing code and avoid the unnecessary usage of Class.forName().
